conclusion: Analyze forces on the charged ball to derive electric field strength.
Ball with mass m and charge q is suspended by a string of length L at angle θ from vertical in a horizontal electric field.
Forces must balance as the ball is at rest: tension in the string and electric force.
Electric force is F_e = qE, where E is the electric field strength.
Vertical component of tension T cos θ balances weight mg: T cos θ = mg.
Horizontal component of tension T sin θ balances electric force: T sin θ = qE.
From vertical balance, T = mg / cos θ.
Substitute into horizontal balance: (mg / cos θ) sin θ = qE.
Simplify to mg tan θ = qE.
Electric field strength E = (mg tan θ) / q.
